trans-unit.source: An end-to-end guide to resources and information for developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) games.
trans-unit.target: An end-to-end guide to resources and information for developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) games.

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Welcome to the Windows 10 game development guide!
trans-unit.target: Welcome to the Windows 10 game development guide!

trans-unit.source: This guide provides an end-to-end collection of the resources and information you'll need to develop a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) game.
trans-unit.target: This guide provides an end-to-end collection of the resources and information you'll need to develop a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) game.

trans-unit.source: Introduction to game development for the Universal Windows Platform (UWP)
trans-unit.target: Introduction to game development for the Universal Windows Platform (UWP)

trans-unit.source: When you create a Windows 10 game, you have the opportunity to reach millions of players worldwide across phone, PC, and Xbox One.
trans-unit.target: When you create a Windows 10 game, you have the opportunity to reach millions of players worldwide across phone, PC, and Xbox One.

trans-unit.source: With Xbox on Windows, Xbox Live, cross-device multiplayer, an amazing gaming community, and powerful new features like the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) and DirectX 12, Windows 10 games thrill players of all ages and genres.
trans-unit.target: With Xbox on Windows, Xbox Live, cross-device multiplayer, an amazing gaming community, and powerful new features like the Universal Windows Platform (UWP) and DirectX 12, Windows 10 games thrill players of all ages and genres.

trans-unit.source: The new Universal Windows Platform (UWP) delivers compatibility for your game across Windows 10 devices with a common API for phone, PC, and Xbox One, along with tools and options to tailor your game to each device experience.
trans-unit.target: The new Universal Windows Platform (UWP) delivers compatibility for your game across Windows 10 devices with a common API for phone, PC, and Xbox One, along with tools and options to tailor your game to each device experience.

trans-unit.source: This guide provides an end-to-end collection of information and resources that will help you as you develop your game.
trans-unit.target: This guide provides an end-to-end collection of information and resources that will help you as you develop your game.

trans-unit.source: The sections are organized according to the stages of game development, so you'll know where to look for information when you need it.
trans-unit.target: The sections are organized according to the stages of game development, so you'll know where to look for information when you need it.

trans-unit.source: To get started, the [Game development resources](#resources) section provides a high-level survey of documentation, programs, and other resources that are helpful when creating a game.
trans-unit.target: To get started, the [Game development resources](#resources) section provides a high-level survey of documentation, programs, and other resources that are helpful when creating a game.

trans-unit.source: This guide will be updated as additional Windows 10 game development resources and material become available.
trans-unit.target: This guide will be updated as additional Windows 10 game development resources and material become available.

trans-unit.source: From documentation to developer programs, forums, blogs, and samples, there are many resources available to help you on your game development journey.
trans-unit.target: From documentation to developer programs, forums, blogs, and samples, there are many resources available to help you on your game development journey.

trans-unit.source: Here's a roundup of resources to know about as you begin developing your Windows 10 game.
trans-unit.target: Here's a roundup of resources to know about as you begin developing your Windows 10 game.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Xbox One development and select Windows 10 gaming features (Xbox Live Services, for example) are managed through programs such as ID@Xbox and Microsoft Studios.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Xbox One development and select Windows 10 gaming features (Xbox Live Services, for example) are managed through programs such as ID@Xbox and Microsoft Studios.

trans-unit.source: This guide covers a broad range of resources, so you may find that some resources are inaccessible depending on the program you are in or your specific development role.
trans-unit.target: This guide covers a broad range of resources, so you may find that some resources are inaccessible depending on the program you are in or your specific development role.

trans-unit.source: Examples are links that resolve to developer.xboxlive.com, forums.xboxlive.com, xdi.xboxlive.com, or the Game Developer Network (GDN).
trans-unit.target: Examples are links that resolve to developer.xboxlive.com, forums.xboxlive.com, xdi.xboxlive.com, or the Game Developer Network (GDN).

trans-unit.source: For information about partnering with Microsoft, see [Developer Programs](#programs).
trans-unit.target: For information about partnering with Microsoft, see [Developer Programs](#programs).

trans-unit.source: Throughout this guide, you'll find deep links to relevant documentation—organized by task, technology, and stage of game development.
trans-unit.target: Throughout this guide, you'll find deep links to relevant documentation—organized by task, technology, and stage of game development.

trans-unit.source: To give you a broad view of what's available, here are the main documentation portals for Windows 10 game development.
trans-unit.target: To give you a broad view of what's available, here are the main documentation portals for Windows 10 game development.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft offers several developer programs to help you develop and publish Windows games.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft offers several developer programs to help you develop and publish Windows games.

trans-unit.source: To publish a game in the Windows Store, you'll need to create a developer account on Windows Dev Center.
trans-unit.target: To publish a game in the Windows Store, you'll need to create a developer account on Windows Dev Center.

trans-unit.source: Other programs may be of interest depending on your game and studio needs, and can create opportunities such as Xbox One development and Xbox Live integration.
trans-unit.target: Other programs may be of interest depending on your game and studio needs, and can create opportunities such as Xbox One development and Xbox Live integration.

trans-unit.source: Registering a developer account on the Windows Dev Center is the first step towards publishing your Windows game.
trans-unit.target: Registering a developer account on the Windows Dev Center is the first step towards publishing your Windows game.

trans-unit.source: A developer account lets you reserve your game's name and submit free or paid games to the Windows Store for all Windows devices.
trans-unit.target: A developer account lets you reserve your game's name and submit free or paid games to the Windows Store for all Windows devices.

trans-unit.source: Use your developer account to manage your game and in-game products, get detailed analytics, and enable services that create great experiences for your players around the world.
trans-unit.target: Use your developer account to manage your game and in-game products, get detailed analytics, and enable services that create great experiences for your players around the world.

trans-unit.source: The ID@Xbox program helps qualified game developers self-publish on Windows and Xbox One.
trans-unit.target: The ID@Xbox program helps qualified game developers self-publish on Windows and Xbox One.

trans-unit.source: If you want to develop for Xbox One, or add Xbox Live features like Gamerscore, achievements, and leaderboards to your Windows 10 game, sign up with ID@Xbox.
trans-unit.target: If you want to develop for Xbox One, or add Xbox Live features like Gamerscore, achievements, and leaderboards to your Windows 10 game, sign up with ID@Xbox.

trans-unit.source: Become an ID@Xbox developer to get the tools and support you need to unleash your creativity and maximize your success.
trans-unit.target: Become an ID@Xbox developer to get the tools and support you need to unleash your creativity and maximize your success.

trans-unit.source: Before applying to ID@Xbox, please register a developer account on Windows Dev Center.
trans-unit.target: Before applying to ID@Xbox, please register a developer account on Windows Dev Center.

trans-unit.source: Independent Developer Program for Xbox One
trans-unit.target: Independent Developer Program for Xbox One

trans-unit.source: Professional game developers who want early previews of Direct3D 12 API changes and want to provide feedback on the forums can join the DirectX early access program.
trans-unit.target: Professional game developers who want early previews of Direct3D 12 API changes and want to provide feedback on the forums can join the DirectX early access program.

trans-unit.source: Register for the DirectX 12 early access program
trans-unit.target: Register for the DirectX 12 early access program

trans-unit.source: The Xbox Tools and Middleware Program licenses Xbox development kits to professional developers of game tools and middleware.
trans-unit.target: The Xbox Tools and Middleware Program licenses Xbox development kits to professional developers of game tools and middleware.

trans-unit.source: Developers accepted into the program can share and distribute their Xbox XDK technologies to other licensed Xbox developers.
trans-unit.target: Developers accepted into the program can share and distribute their Xbox XDK technologies to other licensed Xbox developers.

trans-unit.source: Contact the tools and middleware program
trans-unit.target: Contact the tools and middleware program

trans-unit.source: There are many Windows 10 game and app samples available to help you understand Windows 10 gaming features and get a quick start on game development.
trans-unit.target: There are many Windows 10 game and app samples available to help you understand Windows 10 gaming features and get a quick start on game development.

trans-unit.source: More samples are developed and published regularly, so don't forget to occasionally check back at sample portals to see what's new.
trans-unit.target: More samples are developed and published regularly, so don't forget to occasionally check back at sample portals to see what's new.

trans-unit.source: You can also [watch](https://help.github.com/articles/watching-repositories/) GitHub repos to be notified of changes and additions.
trans-unit.target: You can also [watch](https://help.github.com/articles/watching-repositories/) GitHub repos to be notified of changes and additions.

trans-unit.source: Create a simple UWP game with DirectX
trans-unit.target: Create a simple UWP game with DirectX

trans-unit.source: JavaScript and HTML5 touch game sample
trans-unit.target: JavaScript and HTML5 touch game sample

trans-unit.source: Developer forums are a great place to ask and answer game development questions and connect with the game development community.
trans-unit.target: Developer forums are a great place to ask and answer game development questions and connect with the game development community.

trans-unit.source: Forums can also be fantastic resources for finding existing answers to difficult issues that developers have faced and solved in the past.
trans-unit.target: Forums can also be fantastic resources for finding existing answers to difficult issues that developers have faced and solved in the past.

trans-unit.source: Windows Dev Center app developer forums
trans-unit.target: Windows Dev Center app developer forums

trans-unit.source: Windows Dev Center desktop application developer forums
trans-unit.target: Windows Dev Center desktop application developer forums

trans-unit.source: DirectX Windows Store games (archived forum posts)
trans-unit.target: DirectX Windows Store games (archived forum posts)

trans-unit.source: Building Windows Store games with DirectX (archived)
trans-unit.target: Building Windows Store games with DirectX (archived)

trans-unit.source: Developer blogs are another great resource for the latest information about game development.
trans-unit.target: Developer blogs are another great resource for the latest information about game development.

trans-unit.source: You'll find posts about new features, implementation details, best practices, architecture background, and more.
trans-unit.target: You'll find posts about new features, implementation details, best practices, architecture background, and more.

trans-unit.source: In the concept and planning stage, you're deciding what your game is going to be like and the technologies and tools you'll use to bring it to life.
trans-unit.target: In the concept and planning stage, you're deciding what your game is going to be like and the technologies and tools you'll use to bring it to life.

trans-unit.source: When you start developing a game for the UWP you have multiple options available for graphics, input, audio, networking, utilities, and libraries.
trans-unit.target: When you start developing a game for the UWP you have multiple options available for graphics, input, audio, networking, utilities, and libraries.

trans-unit.source: If you've already decided on all the technologies you'll be using in your game, great!
trans-unit.target: If you've already decided on all the technologies you'll be using in your game, great!

trans-unit.source: If not, the [Game technologies for UWP apps](game-development-platform-guide.md) guide is an excellent overview of many of the technologies available, and is highly recommended reading to help you understand the options and how they fit together.
trans-unit.target: If not, the [Game technologies for UWP apps](game-development-platform-guide.md) guide is an excellent overview of many of the technologies available, and is highly recommended reading to help you understand the options and how they fit together.

trans-unit.source: These three GDC 2015 videos give a good overview of Windows 10 game development and the Windows 10 gaming experience.
trans-unit.target: These three GDC 2015 videos give a good overview of Windows 10 game development and the Windows 10 gaming experience.

trans-unit.source: The Future of Gaming Across the Microsoft Ecosystem
trans-unit.target: The Future of Gaming Across the Microsoft Ecosystem

trans-unit.source: Choosing your graphics technology and programming language
trans-unit.target: Choosing your graphics technology and programming language

trans-unit.source: There are several programming languages and graphics technologies available for use in Windows 10 games.
trans-unit.target: There are several programming languages and graphics technologies available for use in Windows 10 games.

trans-unit.source: The path you take depends on the type of game you’re developing, the experience and preferences of your development studio, and specific feature requirements of your game.
trans-unit.target: The path you take depends on the type of game you’re developing, the experience and preferences of your development studio, and specific feature requirements of your game.

trans-unit.source: Will you use C#, C++, or JavaScript?
trans-unit.target: Will you use C#, C++, or JavaScript?

trans-unit.source: Microsoft DirectX is the choice to make for the highest-performance 2D and 3D graphics and multimedia.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft DirectX is the choice to make for the highest-performance 2D and 3D graphics and multimedia.

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 12, new in Windows 10, brings the power of a console-like API and is faster and more efficient than ever before.
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 12, new in Windows 10, brings the power of a console-like API and is faster and more efficient than ever before.

trans-unit.source: Your game can fully utilize modern graphics hardware and feature more objects, richer scenes, and enhanced effects.
trans-unit.target: Your game can fully utilize modern graphics hardware and feature more objects, richer scenes, and enhanced effects.

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 12 delivers optimized graphics on Windows 10 PCs and Xbox One.
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 12 delivers optimized graphics on Windows 10 PCs and Xbox One.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use the familiar graphics pipeline of Direct3D 11, you’ll still benefit from the new rendering and optimization features added to Direct3D 11.3.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use the familiar graphics pipeline of Direct3D 11, you’ll still benefit from the new rendering and optimization features added to Direct3D 11.3.

trans-unit.source: And, if you’re a tried-and-true desktop Windows API developer with roots in Win32, you’ll still have that option in Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: And, if you’re a tried-and-true desktop Windows API developer with roots in Win32, you’ll still have that option in Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: The extensive features and deep platform integration of DirectX provide the power and performance needed by the most demanding games.
trans-unit.target: The extensive features and deep platform integration of DirectX provide the power and performance needed by the most demanding games.

trans-unit.source: XAML is an easy-to-use declarative UI language with convenient features like animations, storyboards, data binding, scalable vector-based graphics, dynamic resizing, and scene graphs.
trans-unit.target: XAML is an easy-to-use declarative UI language with convenient features like animations, storyboards, data binding, scalable vector-based graphics, dynamic resizing, and scene graphs.

trans-unit.source: XAML works great for game UI, menus, sprites, and 2D graphics.
trans-unit.target: XAML works great for game UI, menus, sprites, and 2D graphics.

trans-unit.source: To make UI layout easy, XAML is compatible with design and development tools like Expression Blend and Microsoft Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: To make UI layout easy, XAML is compatible with design and development tools like Expression Blend and Microsoft Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: XAML is commonly used with C#, but C++ is also a good choice if that’s your preferred language or if your game has high CPU demands.
trans-unit.target: XAML is commonly used with C#, but C++ is also a good choice if that’s your preferred language or if your game has high CPU demands.

trans-unit.source: HyperText Markup Language (HTML) is a common UI markup language used for web pages, apps, and rich clients.
trans-unit.target: HyperText Markup Language (HTML) is a common UI markup language used for web pages, apps, and rich clients.

trans-unit.source: Windows games can use HTML5 as a full-featured presentation layer with the familiar features of HTML, access to the Universal Windows Platform, and support for modern web features like AppCache, Web Workers, canvas, drag-and-drop, asynchronous programming, and SVG.
trans-unit.target: Windows games can use HTML5 as a full-featured presentation layer with the familiar features of HTML, access to the Universal Windows Platform, and support for modern web features like AppCache, Web Workers, canvas, drag-and-drop, asynchronous programming, and SVG.

trans-unit.source: Behind the scenes, HTML rendering takes advantage of the power of DirectX hardware acceleration, so you can still get the performance benefits of DirectX without writing any extra code.
trans-unit.target: Behind the scenes, HTML rendering takes advantage of the power of DirectX hardware acceleration, so you can still get the performance benefits of DirectX without writing any extra code.

trans-unit.source: HTML5 is a good choice if you are proficient with web development, porting a web game, or want to use language and graphics layers that can be easier to approach than the other choices.
trans-unit.target: HTML5 is a good choice if you are proficient with web development, porting a web game, or want to use language and graphics layers that can be easier to approach than the other choices.

trans-unit.source: HTML5 is used with JavaScript, but can also call into components created with C# or C++/CX.
trans-unit.target: HTML5 is used with JavaScript, but can also call into components created with C# or C++/CX.

trans-unit.source: HTML5 and Document Object Model information
trans-unit.target: HTML5 and Document Object Model information

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft DirectX Graphics Infrastructure (DXGI) provides interop and compatibility across multiple graphics technologies.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft DirectX Graphics Infrastructure (DXGI) provides interop and compatibility across multiple graphics technologies.

trans-unit.source: For high-performance graphics, you can combine XAML and DirectX, using XAML for menus and other simple UI, and DirectX for rendering complex 2D and 3D scenes.
trans-unit.target: For high-performance graphics, you can combine XAML and DirectX, using XAML for menus and other simple UI, and DirectX for rendering complex 2D and 3D scenes.

trans-unit.source: DXGI also provides compatibility between Direct2D, Direct3D, DirectWrite, DirectCompute, and the Microsoft Media Foundation.
trans-unit.target: DXGI also provides compatibility between Direct2D, Direct3D, DirectWrite, DirectCompute, and the Microsoft Media Foundation.

trans-unit.source: DirectX Graphics Infrastructure programming guide and reference
trans-unit.target: DirectX Graphics Infrastructure programming guide and reference

trans-unit.source: C++/CX is a high-performance, low overhead language that provides the powerful combination of speed, compatibility, and platform access.
trans-unit.target: C++/CX is a high-performance, low overhead language that provides the powerful combination of speed, compatibility, and platform access.

trans-unit.source: C++/CX makes it easy to use all of the great gaming features in Windows 10, including DirectX and Xbox Live.
trans-unit.target: C++/CX makes it easy to use all of the great gaming features in Windows 10, including DirectX and Xbox Live.

trans-unit.source: You can also reuse existing C++ code and libraries.
trans-unit.target: You can also reuse existing C++ code and libraries.

trans-unit.source: C++/CX creates fast, native code that doesn’t incur the overhead of garbage collection, so your game can have great performance and low power consumption, which leads to longer battery life.
trans-unit.target: C++/CX creates fast, native code that doesn’t incur the overhead of garbage collection, so your game can have great performance and low power consumption, which leads to longer battery life.

trans-unit.source: Use C++/CX with DirectX or XAML, or create a game that uses a combination of both.
trans-unit.target: Use C++/CX with DirectX or XAML, or create a game that uses a combination of both.

trans-unit.source: Visual C++ programming guide and reference
trans-unit.target: Visual C++ programming guide and reference

trans-unit.source: C# (pronounced "C sharp") is a modern, innovative language that is simple, powerful, type-safe, and object-oriented.
trans-unit.target: C# (pronounced "C sharp") is a modern, innovative language that is simple, powerful, type-safe, and object-oriented.

trans-unit.source: C# enables rapid development while retaining the familiarity and expressiveness of C-style languages.
trans-unit.target: C# enables rapid development while retaining the familiarity and expressiveness of C-style languages.

trans-unit.source: Though easy to use, C# has numerous advanced language features like polymorphism, delegates, lambdas, closures, iterator methods, covariance, and Language-Integrated Query (LINQ) expressions.
trans-unit.target: Though easy to use, C# has numerous advanced language features like polymorphism, delegates, lambdas, closures, iterator methods, covariance, and Language-Integrated Query (LINQ) expressions.

trans-unit.source: C# is an excellent choice if you are targeting XAML, want to get a quick start developing your game, or have previous C# experience.
trans-unit.target: C# is an excellent choice if you are targeting XAML, want to get a quick start developing your game, or have previous C# experience.

trans-unit.source: C# is used primarily with XAML, so if you want to use DirectX, choose C++ instead, or write part of your game as a C++ component that interacts with DirectX.
trans-unit.target: C# is used primarily with XAML, so if you want to use DirectX, choose C++ instead, or write part of your game as a C++ component that interacts with DirectX.

trans-unit.source: Or, consider [Win2D](https://github.com/Microsoft/Win2D), an immediate mode Direct2D graphics libary for C# and C++.
trans-unit.target: Or, consider [Win2D](https://github.com/Microsoft/Win2D), an immediate mode Direct2D graphics libary for C# and C++.

trans-unit.source: JavaScript is a dynamic scripting language widely used for modern web and rich client applications.
trans-unit.target: JavaScript is a dynamic scripting language widely used for modern web and rich client applications.

trans-unit.source: Windows JavaScript apps can access the powerful features of the Universal Windows Platform in an easy, intuitive way—as methods and properties of object-oriented JavaScript classes.
trans-unit.target: Windows JavaScript apps can access the powerful features of the Universal Windows Platform in an easy, intuitive way—as methods and properties of object-oriented JavaScript classes.

trans-unit.source: JavaScript is a good choice for your game if you’re coming from a web development environment, are already familiar with JavaScript, or want to use HTML5, CSS, WinJS, or JavaScript libraries.
trans-unit.target: JavaScript is a good choice for your game if you’re coming from a web development environment, are already familiar with JavaScript, or want to use HTML5, CSS, WinJS, or JavaScript libraries.

trans-unit.source: If you’re targeting DirectX or XAML, choose C# or C++/CX instead.
trans-unit.target: If you’re targeting DirectX or XAML, choose C# or C++/CX instead.

trans-unit.source: Use Windows Runtime Components to combine languages
trans-unit.target: Use Windows Runtime Components to combine languages

trans-unit.source: With the Universal Windows Platform, it’s easy to combine components written in different languages.
trans-unit.target: With the Universal Windows Platform, it’s easy to combine components written in different languages.

trans-unit.source: Create Windows Runtime Components in C++, C#, or Visual Basic, and then call into them from JavaScript, C#, C++, or Visual Basic.
trans-unit.target: Create Windows Runtime Components in C++, C#, or Visual Basic, and then call into them from JavaScript, C#, C++, or Visual Basic.

trans-unit.source: This is a great way to program portions of your game in the language of your choice.
trans-unit.target: This is a great way to program portions of your game in the language of your choice.

trans-unit.source: Components also let you consume external libraries that are only available in a particular language, as well as use legacy code you’ve already written.
trans-unit.target: Components also let you consume external libraries that are only available in a particular language, as well as use legacy code you’ve already written.

trans-unit.source: How to create Windows Runtime Components
trans-unit.target: How to create Windows Runtime Components

trans-unit.source: Which version of DirectX should your game use?
trans-unit.target: Which version of DirectX should your game use?

trans-unit.source: If you are choosing DirectX for your game, you'll need to decide which version to use: Microsoft Direct3D 12 or Microsoft Direct3D 11.
trans-unit.target: If you are choosing DirectX for your game, you'll need to decide which version to use: Microsoft Direct3D 12 or Microsoft Direct3D 11.

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 11.3 is a low level graphics API that uses the familiar Direct3D programming model.
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 11.3 is a low level graphics API that uses the familiar Direct3D programming model.

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 11 is still an option for a Universal Windows app, and you'll have access to the new rendering and optimization features added in Direct3D 11.3.
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 11 is still an option for a Universal Windows app, and you'll have access to the new rendering and optimization features added in Direct3D 11.3.

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 12 is new in Windows 10 and introduces a new pipeline programming model.
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 12 is new in Windows 10 and introduces a new pipeline programming model.

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 12 is closer to the hardware, uses less abstraction, and gives your game better control over resource use.
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 12 is closer to the hardware, uses less abstraction, and gives your game better control over resource use.

trans-unit.source: Direct3D 12 has better CPU, GPU, and power performance.
trans-unit.target: Direct3D 12 has better CPU, GPU, and power performance.

trans-unit.source: If you have an existing engine written in Direct3D 11, and you're not quite ready to make the jump to Direct3D 12, you can use Direct3D 11 on 12 to achieve some performance improvements and begin your transition to Direct3D 12.
trans-unit.target: If you have an existing engine written in Direct3D 11, and you're not quite ready to make the jump to Direct3D 12, you can use Direct3D 11 on 12 to achieve some performance improvements and begin your transition to Direct3D 12.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the needs of your game, using bridges, game engines, or middleware can save development and testing time and resources.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the needs of your game, using bridges, game engines, or middleware can save development and testing time and resources.

trans-unit.source: Here are some overview and resources for bridges, game engines, and middleware to help you decide if any are right for you.
trans-unit.target: Here are some overview and resources for bridges, game engines, and middleware to help you decide if any are right for you.

trans-unit.source: Bridges and game engines for Windows 10 (blog post)
trans-unit.target: Bridges and game engines for Windows 10 (blog post)

trans-unit.source: More ways to bring your code to fast-growing Windows 10 Store
trans-unit.target: More ways to bring your code to fast-growing Windows 10 Store

trans-unit.source: Accelerating Windows Store Game Development with Middleware
trans-unit.target: Accelerating Windows Store Game Development with Middleware

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio and Unity, Unreal, and Cocos2d (blog post)
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio and Unity, Unreal, and Cocos2d (blog post)

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio for Game Development: New Partnerships with Unity, Unreal Engine and Cocos2d
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio for Game Development: New Partnerships with Unity, Unreal Engine and Cocos2d

trans-unit.source: Game Development Middleware - What is it?
trans-unit.target: Game Development Middleware - What is it?

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform Bridges are technologies that bring your existing app or game over to the UWP.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform Bridges are technologies that bring your existing app or game over to the UWP.

trans-unit.source: Bridges are a great way to get a quick start on UWP game development.
trans-unit.target: Bridges are a great way to get a quick start on UWP game development.

trans-unit.source: Bring your iOS apps to Windows
trans-unit.target: Bring your iOS apps to Windows

trans-unit.source: Windows Bridge for .NET and Win32 ("Project Centennial") preview
trans-unit.target: Windows Bridge for .NET and Win32 ("Project Centennial") preview

trans-unit.source: Unity 5 is the next generation of the award-winning development platform for creating 2D and 3D games and interactive experiences.
trans-unit.target: Unity 5 is the next generation of the award-winning development platform for creating 2D and 3D games and interactive experiences.

trans-unit.source: Unity 5 brings new artistic power, enhanced graphics capabilities, and improved efficiency.
trans-unit.target: Unity 5 brings new artistic power, enhanced graphics capabilities, and improved efficiency.

trans-unit.source: On the [Unity roadmap](https://unity3d.com/unity/roadmap), support for DirectX 12 will be coming in a future version of Unity.
trans-unit.target: On the [Unity roadmap](https://unity3d.com/unity/roadmap), support for DirectX 12 will be coming in a future version of Unity.

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows app support in Unity 5.2 (blog post)
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows app support in Unity 5.2 (blog post)

trans-unit.source: Publish your Unity game as a Universal Windows app (video)
trans-unit.target: Publish your Unity game as a Universal Windows app (video)

trans-unit.source: How to publish your Unity game as a UWP app
trans-unit.target: How to publish your Unity game as a UWP app

trans-unit.source: Use Unity to make Windows games and apps (video)
trans-unit.target: Use Unity to make Windows games and apps (video)

trans-unit.source: Making Windows games and apps with Unity
trans-unit.target: Making Windows games and apps with Unity

trans-unit.source: Unity game development using Visual Studio (video series)
trans-unit.target: Unity game development using Visual Studio (video series)

trans-unit.source: Havok’s modular suite of tools and technologies help game creators reach new levels of interactivity and immersion.
trans-unit.target: Havok’s modular suite of tools and technologies help game creators reach new levels of interactivity and immersion.

trans-unit.source: Havok enables highly realistic physics, interactive simulations, and stunning cinematics.
trans-unit.target: Havok enables highly realistic physics, interactive simulations, and stunning cinematics.

trans-unit.source: Cocos2d-X is a cross-platform open source game development engine and tools suite that supports building UWP games.
trans-unit.target: Cocos2d-X is a cross-platform open source game development engine and tools suite that supports building UWP games.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with version 3, 3D features are being added as well.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with version 3, 3D features are being added as well.

trans-unit.source: Build a Game with Cocos2d-x for Windows Devices
trans-unit.target: Build a Game with Cocos2d-x for Windows Devices

trans-unit.source: Unreal Engine 4 is a complete suite of game development tools for all types of games and developers.
trans-unit.target: Unreal Engine 4 is a complete suite of game development tools for all types of games and developers.

trans-unit.source: For the most demanding console and PC games, Unreal Engine is used by game developers worldwide.
trans-unit.target: For the most demanding console and PC games, Unreal Engine is used by game developers worldwide.

trans-unit.source: [DirectX 12 early access program](#dxeap) members who subscribe to Unreal Engine 4 can receive access to an Unreal Engine 4.4 development project that supports DirectX 12.
trans-unit.target: [DirectX 12 early access program](#dxeap) members who subscribe to Unreal Engine 4 can receive access to an Unreal Engine 4.4 development project that supports DirectX 12.

trans-unit.source: There are many other middleware and engine partners that can provide solutions depending on your game development needs.
trans-unit.target: There are many other middleware and engine partners that can provide solutions depending on your game development needs.

trans-unit.source: If you have an existing game, there are many resources and guides available to help you quickly bring your game to the UWP.
trans-unit.target: If you have an existing game, there are many resources and guides available to help you quickly bring your game to the UWP.

trans-unit.source: To jumpstart your porting efforts, you might also consider using a [Universal Windows Platform Bridges](#uwp_bridges).
trans-unit.target: To jumpstart your porting efforts, you might also consider using a [Universal Windows Platform Bridges](#uwp_bridges).

trans-unit.target: Classic Windows API equivalents in the UWP

trans-unit.source: Now that you've decided the type of game you want to create and the tools and graphics technology you'll use to build it, you're ready to get started with the design and prototype.
trans-unit.target: Now that you've decided the type of game you want to create and the tools and graphics technology you'll use to build it, you're ready to get started with the design and prototype.

trans-unit.source: At its core, your game is a Universal Windows app, so that's where you'll begin.
trans-unit.target: At its core, your game is a Universal Windows app, so that's where you'll begin.

trans-unit.source: Introduction to the Universal Windows Platform (UWP)
trans-unit.target: Introduction to the Universal Windows Platform (UWP)

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 introduces the Universal Windows Platform (UWP), which provides a common API platform across Windows 10 devices.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 introduces the Universal Windows Platform (UWP), which provides a common API platform across Windows 10 devices.

trans-unit.source: UWP evolves and expands the Windows Runtime model and hones it into a cohesive, unified core.
trans-unit.target: UWP evolves and expands the Windows Runtime model and hones it into a cohesive, unified core.

trans-unit.source: Games that target the UWP can call WinRT APIs that are common to all devices.
trans-unit.target: Games that target the UWP can call WinRT APIs that are common to all devices.

trans-unit.source: Because the UWP provides a guaranteed core API layer, you can choose to create a single app package that will install across Windows 10 devices.
trans-unit.target: Because the UWP provides a guaranteed core API layer, you can choose to create a single app package that will install across Windows 10 devices.

trans-unit.source: And if you want to, your game can still call APIs (including some classic Windows APIs from Win32 and .NET) that are specific to the devices your game runs on.
trans-unit.target: And if you want to, your game can still call APIs (including some classic Windows APIs from Win32 and .NET) that are specific to the devices your game runs on.

trans-unit.source: The goal of the UWP is to have:
trans-unit.target: The goal of the UWP is to have:

trans-unit.source: The following are excellent guides that discuss the UWP and Universal Windows apps in detail, and are recommended reading to help you understand the platform.
trans-unit.target: The following are excellent guides that discuss the UWP and Universal Windows apps in detail, and are recommended reading to help you understand the platform.

trans-unit.source: Getting set up and ready to develop a Universal Windows app is quick and easy.
trans-unit.target: Getting set up and ready to develop a Universal Windows app is quick and easy.

trans-unit.source: The following guides take you through the process step-by-step.
trans-unit.target: The following guides take you through the process step-by-step.

trans-unit.source: Getting set up for UWP development
trans-unit.target: Getting set up for UWP development

trans-unit.source: If you're an "absolute beginner" to UWP programming, and are considering using XAML in your game (see [Choosing your graphics technology and programming language](#choosing_technology)), the [Windows 10 development for absolute beginners](https://channel9.msdn.com/Series/Windows-10-development-for-absolute-beginners) video series is a good place to start.
trans-unit.target: If you're an "absolute beginner" to UWP programming, and are considering using XAML in your game (see [Choosing your graphics technology and programming language](#choosing_technology)), the [Windows 10 development for absolute beginners](https://channel9.msdn.com/Series/Windows-10-development-for-absolute-beginners) video series is a good place to start.

trans-unit.source: Beginners guide to Windows 10 development with XAML (Video series)
trans-unit.target: Beginners guide to Windows 10 development with XAML (Video series)

trans-unit.source: Announcing the Windows 10 absolute beginners series using XAML (blog post)
trans-unit.target: Announcing the Windows 10 absolute beginners series using XAML (blog post)

trans-unit.source: Overview of Universal Windows app development
trans-unit.target: Overview of Universal Windows app development

trans-unit.source: Overview of network programming in the UWP
trans-unit.target: Overview of network programming in the UWP

trans-unit.target: Using Windows.Web.HTTP and Windows.Networking.Sockets in games

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous programming concepts in the UWP
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous programming concepts in the UWP

trans-unit.source: Process lifetime management, or app lifecyle, describes the various activation states that a Universal Windows app can transition through.
trans-unit.target: Process lifetime management, or app lifecyle, describes the various activation states that a Universal Windows app can transition through.

trans-unit.source: Your game can be activated, suspended, resumed, or terminated, and can transition through those states in a variety of ways.
trans-unit.target: Your game can be activated, suspended, resumed, or terminated, and can transition through those states in a variety of ways.

trans-unit.source: Using Microsoft Visual Studio to trigger app transitions
trans-unit.target: Using Microsoft Visual Studio to trigger app transitions

trans-unit.source: How to trigger suspend, resume, and background events for Windows Store apps in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: How to trigger suspend, resume, and background events for Windows Store apps in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: The genesis of a great game is inspired design.
trans-unit.target: The genesis of a great game is inspired design.

trans-unit.source: Games share some common user interface elements and design principles with apps, but games often have a unique look, feel, and design goal for their user experience.
trans-unit.target: Games share some common user interface elements and design principles with apps, but games often have a unique look, feel, and design goal for their user experience.

trans-unit.source: Games succeed when thoughtful design is applied to both aspects—when should your game use tested UX, and when should it diverge and innovate?
trans-unit.target: Games succeed when thoughtful design is applied to both aspects—when should your game use tested UX, and when should it diverge and innovate?

trans-unit.source: The presentation technology that you choose for your game—DirectX, XAML, HTML5, or some combination of the three—will influence implementation details, but the design principles you apply are largely independent of that choice.
trans-unit.target: The presentation technology that you choose for your game—DirectX, XAML, HTML5, or some combination of the three—will influence implementation details, but the design principles you apply are largely independent of that choice.

trans-unit.source: Separately from UX design, gameplay design such as level design, pacing, world design, and other aspects is an art form of its own—one that's up to you and your team, and not covered in this development guide.
trans-unit.target: Separately from UX design, gameplay design such as level design, pacing, world design, and other aspects is an art form of its own—one that's up to you and your team, and not covered in this development guide.

trans-unit.source: UX guidelines for launch, suspend, and resume
trans-unit.target: UX guidelines for launch, suspend, and resume

trans-unit.source: Designing Games for a Windows Core World
trans-unit.target: Designing Games for a Windows Core World

trans-unit.source: Following a consistent color guideline in your game improves aesthetics, aids navigation, and is a powerful tool to inform the player of menu and HUD functionality.
trans-unit.target: Following a consistent color guideline in your game improves aesthetics, aids navigation, and is a powerful tool to inform the player of menu and HUD functionality.

trans-unit.source: Consistent coloring of game elements like warnings, damage, XP, and achievements can lead to cleaner UI and reduce the need for explicit labels.
trans-unit.target: Consistent coloring of game elements like warnings, damage, XP, and achievements can lead to cleaner UI and reduce the need for explicit labels.

trans-unit.source: The appropriate use of typography enhances many aspects of your game, including UI layout, navigation, readability, atmosphere, brand, and player immersion.
trans-unit.target: The appropriate use of typography enhances many aspects of your game, including UI layout, navigation, readability, atmosphere, brand, and player immersion.

trans-unit.source: A UI map is a layout of game navigation and menus expressed as a flowchart.
trans-unit.target: A UI map is a layout of game navigation and menus expressed as a flowchart.

trans-unit.source: The UI map helps all involved stakeholders understand the game’s interface and navigation paths, and can expose potential roadblocks and dead ends early in the development cycle.
trans-unit.target: The UI map helps all involved stakeholders understand the game’s interface and navigation paths, and can expose potential roadblocks and dead ends early in the development cycle.

trans-unit.source: DirectX game development on the UWP
trans-unit.target: DirectX game development on the UWP

trans-unit.source: DirectX interaction with the UWP app model
trans-unit.target: DirectX interaction with the UWP app model

trans-unit.source: Better Power, Better Performance: Your Game on DirectX 12
trans-unit.target: Better Power, Better Performance: Your Game on DirectX 12

trans-unit.source: The DirectX Tool Kit, DirectX texture processing library, and DirectXMesh geometry processing library provide texture, mesh, sprite, and other utility functionality and helper classes for DirectX development.
trans-unit.target: The DirectX Tool Kit, DirectX texture processing library, and DirectXMesh geometry processing library provide texture, mesh, sprite, and other utility functionality and helper classes for DirectX development.

trans-unit.source: These libraries can save a lot of time and effort compared to implementing these features yourself.
trans-unit.target: These libraries can save a lot of time and effort compared to implementing these features yourself.

trans-unit.source: Though implemented primarily for Direct3D 11, some portions of these libraries also work in Direct3D 12.
trans-unit.target: Though implemented primarily for Direct3D 11, some portions of these libraries also work in Direct3D 12.

trans-unit.source: Get the DirectX texture processing library (DirectX 11)
trans-unit.target: Get the DirectX texture processing library (DirectX 11)

trans-unit.source: Get the DirectXMesh geometry processing library
trans-unit.target: Get the DirectXMesh geometry processing library

trans-unit.target: Direct3D 12 support in the DirectXTK (blog post)

trans-unit.source: Your studio is now fully engaged and moving into the production cycle, with work distributed throughout your team.
trans-unit.target: Your studio is now fully engaged and moving into the production cycle, with work distributed throughout your team.

trans-unit.source: You're polishing, refactoring, and extending the prototype to craft it into a full game.
trans-unit.target: You're polishing, refactoring, and extending the prototype to craft it into a full game.

trans-unit.source: A tile is your game's representation on the Start Menu.
trans-unit.target: A tile is your game's representation on the Start Menu.

trans-unit.source: Tiles and notifications can drive player interest even when they aren't currently playing your game.
trans-unit.target: Tiles and notifications can drive player interest even when they aren't currently playing your game.

trans-unit.source: Sample illustrating live tiles and notifications
trans-unit.target: Sample illustrating live tiles and notifications

trans-unit.source: Adaptive Tile Templates - Schema and Documentation
trans-unit.target: Adaptive Tile Templates - Schema and Documentation

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 app for interactively developing live tile templates
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 app for interactively developing live tile templates

trans-unit.source: An IAP (in-app product) is a supplementary item that players can purchase in-game.
trans-unit.target: An IAP (in-app product) is a supplementary item that players can purchase in-game.

trans-unit.source: IAPs can be new add-ons, game levels, items, or anything else that your players might enjoy.
trans-unit.target: IAPs can be new add-ons, game levels, items, or anything else that your players might enjoy.

trans-unit.source: Used appropriately, IAPs can provide revenue while improving the game experience.
trans-unit.target: Used appropriately, IAPs can provide revenue while improving the game experience.

trans-unit.source: You define and publish your game's IAPs through the Windows Dev Center dashboard, and enable in-app purchases in your game's code.
trans-unit.target: You define and publish your game's IAPs through the Windows Dev Center dashboard, and enable in-app purchases in your game's code.

trans-unit.source: Monitor IAP sales and demographics for your game
trans-unit.target: Monitor IAP sales and demographics for your game

trans-unit.source: Some portions of DirectX development can be nuanced and complex.
trans-unit.target: Some portions of DirectX development can be nuanced and complex.

trans-unit.source: When you get to the point in production where you need to dig down into the details of your DirectX engine, or debug difficult performance problems, the resources and information in this section can help.
trans-unit.target: When you get to the point in production where you need to dig down into the details of your DirectX engine, or debug difficult performance problems, the resources and information in this section can help.

trans-unit.source: Solve the Tough Graphics Problems with Your Game Using DirectX Tools
trans-unit.target: Solve the Tough Graphics Problems with Your Game Using DirectX Tools

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft DirectX product team has produced a series of in-depth videos about DirectX 12 development.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft DirectX product team has produced a series of in-depth videos about DirectX 12 development.

trans-unit.source: They cover the details of resource binding, presentation modes, debugging, resource barriers, and many other DirectX 12 concepts.
trans-unit.target: They cover the details of resource binding, presentation modes, debugging, resource barriers, and many other DirectX 12 concepts.

trans-unit.source: This series also occasionally features guest presenters.
trans-unit.target: This series also occasionally features guest presenters.

trans-unit.source: Graphics and DirectX 12 development videos (Youtube channel)
trans-unit.target: Graphics and DirectX 12 development videos (Youtube channel)

trans-unit.source: Develop world-ready games for the Windows platform and learn about the international features built into Microsoft’s top products.
trans-unit.target: Develop world-ready games for the Windows platform and learn about the international features built into Microsoft’s top products.

trans-unit.source: Preparing your game for the global market
trans-unit.target: Preparing your game for the global market

trans-unit.source: Guidelines when developing for a global audience
trans-unit.target: Guidelines when developing for a global audience

trans-unit.target: Online resource for language conventions and standard Microsoft terminology

trans-unit.source: The following guides and information help make the publishing and submission process as smooth as possible.
trans-unit.target: The following guides and information help make the publishing and submission process as smooth as possible.

trans-unit.source: You'll use the new unified Windows Dev Center dashboard to publish and manage your game packages.
trans-unit.target: You'll use the new unified Windows Dev Center dashboard to publish and manage your game packages.

trans-unit.source: Single workflow to assign age ratings using IARC system
trans-unit.target: Single workflow to assign age ratings using IARC system

trans-unit.target: Packaging your game as a 3rd party developer (blog post)

trans-unit.source: Create uploadable packages without publisher's store account access
trans-unit.target: Create uploadable packages without publisher's store account access

trans-unit.source: Don't let certification issues delay your game's release.
trans-unit.target: Don't let certification issues delay your game's release.

trans-unit.source: Here are policies and common certification issues to be aware of.
trans-unit.target: Here are policies and common certification issues to be aware of.

trans-unit.source: Policies for publishing apps in the Windows Store
trans-unit.target: Policies for publishing apps in the Windows Store

trans-unit.source: How to avoid some common app certification issues
trans-unit.target: How to avoid some common app certification issues

trans-unit.source: The store manifest (StoreManifest.xml) is an optional configuration file that can be included in your app package.
trans-unit.target: The store manifest (StoreManifest.xml) is an optional configuration file that can be included in your app package.

trans-unit.source: The store manifest provides additional features that are not part of the AppxManifest.xml file.
trans-unit.target: The store manifest provides additional features that are not part of the AppxManifest.xml file.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can use the store manifest to block installation of your game if a target device doesn't have the specified minimum DirectX feature level, or the specified minimum system memory.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can use the store manifest to block installation of your game if a target device doesn't have the specified minimum DirectX feature level, or the specified minimum system memory.

trans-unit.source: After you've finished development and shipped your game, it's not "game over".
trans-unit.target: After you've finished development and shipped your game, it's not "game over".

trans-unit.source: You may be done with development on version one, but your game's journey in the marketplace has only just begun.
trans-unit.target: You may be done with development on version one, but your game's journey in the marketplace has only just begun.

trans-unit.source: You'll want to monitor usage and error reporting, respond to user feedback, and publish updates to your game.
trans-unit.target: You'll want to monitor usage and error reporting, respond to user feedback, and publish updates to your game.

trans-unit.source: Windows Dev Center analytics and promotion
trans-unit.target: Windows Dev Center analytics and promotion

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Application Insights provides performance, telemetry, and usage analytics for your published game.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Application Insights provides performance, telemetry, and usage analytics for your published game.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights helps you detect and solve issues after your game is released, continuously monitor and improve usage, and understand how players are continuing to interact with your game.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights helps you detect and solve issues after your game is released, continuously monitor and improve usage, and understand how players are continuing to interact with your game.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights works by adding an SDK into your app, which sends telemetry to the [Azure portal](http://portal.azure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Application Insights works by adding an SDK into your app, which sends telemetry to the [Azure portal](http://portal.azure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Enable Application Insights in Windows apps
trans-unit.target: Enable Application Insights in Windows apps

trans-unit.source: Application Insights for Windows Phone and Store apps
trans-unit.target: Application Insights for Windows Phone and Store apps

trans-unit.source: To update your published game, submit a new app package with a higher version number.
trans-unit.target: To update your published game, submit a new app package with a higher version number.

trans-unit.source: After the package makes its way through submission and certification, it will automatically be available to customers as an update.
trans-unit.target: After the package makes its way through submission and certification, it will automatically be available to customers as an update.

trans-unit.target: Adding Xbox Live to your game

trans-unit.source: **Note** Xbox Live development is managed through programs such as ID@Xbox and Microsoft Studios.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Xbox Live development is managed through programs such as ID@Xbox and Microsoft Studios.

trans-unit.source: This guide covers a broad range of resources, and you may find that some resources are inaccessible depending on your program participation or specific development role.
trans-unit.target: This guide covers a broad range of resources, and you may find that some resources are inaccessible depending on your program participation or specific development role.

trans-unit.source: Examples are links that resolve to developer.xboxlive.com, forums.xboxlive.com, xdi.xboxlive.com, or the Game Developer Network (GDN).
trans-unit.target: Examples are links that resolve to developer.xboxlive.com, forums.xboxlive.com, xdi.xboxlive.com, or the Game Developer Network (GDN).

trans-unit.target: For information about partnering with Microsoft, see [Developer Programs](#programs).
